name: GlProgramOptions
description: The options for the gl program

properties.name: name
properties.description: the name of the program, defaults to 'pixi-program'

properties.name: preferredVertexPrecision
properties.description: the preferred vertex precision for the shader, this may not be used if the device does not support it

properties.name: preferredFragmentPrecision
properties.description: the preferred fragment precision for the shader, this may not be used if the device does not support it

properties.name: processes
https
properties.type:
//developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WebGLProgram
 * @example
 *
 * // Create a new program
 * const program = new GlProgram({
 *   vertex: '...',
 *   fragment: '...',
 * })

properties.name: automatically
properties.type:
*
* - If no precision is provided in the shader, it will be injected into the program source for you. * This precision will be taken form the options provided, if none is provided, * then the program will default to the defaultOptions. *
* - It will inject the program name into the shader source if none is provided. *
* - It will set the program version to 300 es. * * For optimal usage and best performance, its best to reuse programs as much as possible. * You should use the {@link GlProgram.from} helper function to create programs. * @class * @category rendering * @advanced */ export class GlProgram { /** The default options used by the program. */ public static defaultOptions: Partial = { preferredVertexPrecision: 'highp', preferredFragmentPrecision: 'mediump', }

properties.name: stripVersion
